column20: The Best Hotel I Have Stayed At For Many Years Bar The Ritz In London. The Heating In The St Gertrudes Suite Is Very Noisy During The Night. It Stops You Completely Enjoying What Is A Unique Experience And Kept My Wife Awake Till 0500Hrs. We Both Overslept And Missed Your Amazing Breakfast If Anything Compared With Your Dinner The Night Before.

column20: We Enjoyed Our Visit Enormously. The Murray Family's Personal Welcome And Very Professional But Charming "Hands On" Approach Was Unique In Our Experience! All The Staff Were Lovely And We Noticed They Are Local Which Is Marvellous. The Manor  Rooms And Gardens Are Absolutely Beautiful And Historically Very Interesting. Everything Is Done To Make The Visitor's Stay As Relaxing And Comfortable As Possible  All Our Meals Were Exceedingly Delicious And Service Was Given With An Attention To Every Detail.
column24: We Were Impressed That In Parking Outside Our Arrival Was Noticed And Mrs Murray Came To The Door To Welcome Us. This Is Unique In Our Experience. Before Arriving We Also Received An Email Asking If We Had Any Requests Which Is Very Unusual.
column28: Our Suite (Geraldine) Was Beautiful But  As It Was Exceeding Cold Outside  A Little Chilly At Night As It Has Windows On 3 Sides. It Did Have An Additional Portable Radiator But Perhaps Another Is Needed?
column39: Intimate But Spacious And Beautiful Rooms.
column54: Mr And Mrs Murray  Duncan  And Resident Jack Russell For Their Charming Welcome And Good Humour!
column59: We Look Forward To Visiting Again - Thank You!

column20: We Loved It And Hope To Be Back Soon.
column24: Everything Was Perfect.
column28: We Asked For A Room That Had An Old-Fashioned Feel But A Large Comfortable Bed  And Horsea Was Recommended To Us. We Loved It! It Was Perfect For Our Needs  And Wonderfully Romantic.
column39: We've Becoming Here For Years For Special Celebrations. It's Lovely That The Manor Is In The Hands Of The Murray Family Again.
column54: Everyone Was Lovely.
column59: I Just Wanted To Note That As A Folklorist (And A Novelist/Artist Who Works With Folklore)  Sabine Baring-Gould Is A Major Figure In Our Field For Having Done So Much To Collect And Preserve The Tales And Folksongs Of The Old Moor Dwellers. So That Adds A Special Element To Visiting Lewtrenchard For Me And My Husband. (Plus  I've Read And Enjoyed Laurie R. King's Mystery Novel  The Moor  Set In Lewtrenchard.)  A Number Of Us In The Folklore/Arts Community In Chagford Love To Come To Lewtrenchard For Special Celebrations (Brian & Wendy Froud  Elizabeth-Jane Baldry  And Others)  And Often Recommend It To Our Guests Visiting From America. (Our American Writing Colleagues Ellen Kushner And Delia Sherman Recently Stayed With You  For Example.) Lewtrenchard Is Magical And We Love It. If You're Interested  You Can See Some Of The Pictures I Took During Our Stay On My Writing Blog: Http://Windling.Typepad.Com/Blog/2013/11/Lewtrenchard.Html

column20: Spoilt From Arival To Departure   Really Made To Feel Relaxed And At Home From The Murray Family And All The Staff     Fantastic Food And Service And Such  Beautiful Hotel And Surroundings Cant Wait To Return!

column28: St Gertrude - Spotless  Tastefully Decorated  Extremely Relaxing.   If I Had To Give A Negative Comment The Only One Would Be That The Room Was A Little Cold On Our Arrival  However It Was An Extemely Cold Day And Once The Curtains Were Drawn It Was Warm And Cosy.
column39: Having Stayed Before We Knew Exactly What To Expect And The Food Is Wilthout A Doubt Absolutely Exquisite.   Last Time We Stayed We Had Quite A Giggle When My Husband Was Served With 1 Carrot And This Time Hooted With Laughter When He Had Half A Sprout.   This Is Of Course Part Of The Fine Dining Experience - The Tastes And Presentation Being 2Nd To None.

column39: Generally A Fantastic Dining Experience Due To Waiting Staff  Cuisine And Location. A Minor Criticism We Felt The Tables Should Have Been Cleared Of Both Empty Side Plates And The Wooden Boards Which The Complimentary Sides Arrived On Prior To The Starters Being Served.

column20: We Had A Great Stay At Lewtrenchard Manor With Our Dog Chloe - Despite The Inclement Weather!  Our Dog Is Our Baby  So We Always Appreciate Clean  Welcome And (A Bit Of Luxury) Accommodation And Good Pubs In The Uk For Our Leisure Trips Where Dogs Are Allowed. The Disabled Room (Although We Are Not Disabled) Was Warm.  The Big Bed (A Combination Of 2 Single Beds) Was Comfortable.  We Liked The White Crispy Linen.  The Bathroom Was Clean - We Liked The Strong Water Pressures From The Shower (Most Uk Hotels We Have Stayed At Tend To Have Very Weak Water Pressures). One Thing We Thought Could Enhance Our Stay Was Tea Making Facilities In The Room - Eg Cups And A Jug / Kettle. Overall  We Had A 5* Stay.  Thank You!
column24: None.  Jo At Reception Emailed Us The Confirmation Promptly.
column28: We Have Mentioned Tea Making Facilities In Room.
column39: Our Dog Chloe Was Allowed In The Bar With Us - We Liked To Have Her With Us  Instead Of Leaving Her In The Room.  She Is A Well Behaved Little Dog  Just Sat Quietly With Us While We Dined.
column54: All The Staff Were Great!

column15: Was Married At Lewtrenchard And Had Exclusive Use Of The Manor On December 28Th 2010
column20: Our Experience At Lewtrenchard Was Outstanding. The Murray Family Have Brought A 'Family' Feel To The Business That Is Refreshing And Has An 'Old World' Charm That Outstrips Many Other Hotels. The Quality Of The Von Essen Experience Has Not Been Compromised. The Service From All Staff At Lewtrenchard Is Superb.
column24: Overall  A Superb Experience In All Areas.
column28: Our Stay In The Merrial Suite Was Fantastic. However  Heavy Rain Resulted In Water Leaking Down The Bedroom Wall And There Is Also Mould On The Wall. Furthermore  The Water Pressure In The Bathroom (Toilet  Shower And Bath) Was Low. As Mentioned This Did Not Compromise Our Stay  Which We Throughly Enjoyed.

Excelent Accommodation  Excelent Dining & Excelent Hosts Can Be Found At This Lovely  Family Run  Dog Friendly Country House Hotel.
column24: Thank You For Moving Our Booking At Short Notice.
column39: Sometimes Feel Rushed When Having Pre-Dinner Drinks In The Bar.    Arriving In The Bar Well Ahead Of Our Booked Dining Time  So As To Have A Lazy & Relaxed Tipple  We Are Invariably Called In To The Dining Room Ahead Of Time. Even When We Have Explained That We Are Down Early For A Leisurely Drink & Have Asked Staff [Not Family] Not To Invite Us Through To The Dinning Room Early  The Waiter Collected Us 20 Mins Ahead Of Time.  Would It Be Possible For Staff To Double Check When Taking Our Menu Selections Whether Guests Would Like To Be Seated Earlier Or Whether The Guests Would Prefer To Relax In The Bar Until Their Original Reservation Time.
column54: The Lady Who Usually Manages Reception For The Family.  She Is Always So Welcoming.
column58: Only The Previous Comment About Dinner Timings.

column58: The Drinks Were A Little On The Pricey Side!
column59: Thank You  - It Was Wonderful.

column20: My Wife And I Were Very Impressed By The Friendly Welcome And Service From The Family And The Staff Of The Hotel. Our Room Had Real Character & Was Very Comfortable While Our Evening Meal Was Delicious. It Is Unlikely That We Shall Be Able To Stay Again Only Because It Is Not Far From Our In-Laws And We Broke Our Journey Only Because Of My Recent Operation Which Necessitated My Wife's Doing All The Driving. Nevertheless  We Have Already Spoken To Friends In Glowing Terms About Our Stay & Are Delighted That We Chose To Begin Our Christmas Break By Staying With You. Happy New Year & Wishing You A Successful 2014

column24: It Was Cold Outside And So We Were Looking Forward To A Nice Cosy Warm Afternoon In Our Room - Unfortunately  The Boiler Had An Issue And The Room Was Freezing - Not A Good Start To Our Stay To Be Honest. But Duncan Was Quick Enough To Sort This Out For Us

column20: Not As Wonderful As Previously To Be Completely Honest
column24: We Have Stayed In Aurelia Previously But Sadly There Was An Issue With The Boiler And We Arrived To A Cold Room - Whilst Duncan Did All He Could To Sort As Quickly As Possible  It Didn't Live Up To The Warm And Cosy Afternoon We Had In Mind...................
column28: Aurelia Is At The Back Of The Manor And Whilst We Appreciate Work Has To Be Done  It Is Not Ideal To Have Workers Right Next To Your Room And With Their Radio On............
column39: The Young Man Who Waited On Us (We Have Seen Previously)  Was Excellent. But  The Atmosphere In The Dining Room  We Felt  Lacked A Certain Atmosphere. You Find Yourself Having To Whisper As There Is No Background Music For Example. It Is Not A Massive Space And So I Think Most Guests Keep Their Voices Down And This Doesn't Create The Ideal Dining Situation.
column54: Jo On Reception Has Always Been Outstanding. From Our First Lunch Visit With You  Up Until Our Last Visit..........She Is A First Class Front Line Person And Does The Manor Proud - Excellent Choice Of First Point Of Contact.
column58: Provide The Warm  Tranquil Room We Had Hoped For.  Background Music Of Some Sort Would Be An Excellent Idea In The Dining/Bar/Drinking Areas
column59: Keep Up All The Good Work - You Will Never Please Everybody But It Is A Fabulous Location And No Doubt  A Massive Expenditure To Keep It Looking The Way It Does. But The Manor Does Need Tlc And The Rooms That Have Been Refurbished Are Lovely. Bathrooms Are So Important In A Stay.

column20: Very Enjoyable With Good Service And Yet Discrete
column58: Internal Features Of The Hotel Could Be Made Perhaps A Bit More Welcoming. Currently First Impression Is Rather Austere In Drawing Room Area. Perhaps A Few Books/Magazines And Afternoon Teas Etc Would Enhance It. The Wood Panelling Is Dark But The Paintwork Could Be Lightened?
column59: A Very Nice Hotel Which I Enjoy Enormously. Could Make More Of The Lovely Grounds And Enhance The Ambience Of Some Internal Features.  Food Is Outstanding.  Not Entirely Clear Whether It Is Essentially A Comfortable Hotel With Excellent Restaurant Or Outstanding Restaurant With Reasonable Accommodation!!  The Food Currently Wins!!

column20: A Great Place To "Drop Out" Of The Mad Rush Which Is Our Usual State. It Is So Nice To Feel That One Is A Part Of A Personal Business-Like Being A Guest At A Privat House-Party Rather Than At An Hotel. Just A Shame There Were Not More On The Second Night Of The New Year Break But More Than Made Up For By Our Friends Being Able To Have Dinner With Us.
column24: Alwats A Friendly Response To Phone Calls.
column28: The Shower In Nonnington Is Rather Small And It Is Difficult To Avoid Catching The Hot Tap.
column39: The Food Is Exceptional-When Do You Receive A Michelin Star? The Service Is Also Wonderful-The Right Balance Of Totally Professional But Friendly And Personal.
column54: They Are All Terrific!
column58: No  As We Knew Why We Were Coming Down To Lewtrenchard From Previous Visits And It Lived Up To The Previous Two Experiences.
column59: We Look Forward To Our Next Visit Very Much.

column20: Really Lovely Rooms  Super-Helpful Staff - The Dining Experience Was A Disappointment This Time Around
column24: I Did Email The Hotel Asking For Confirmation That Dinner Was Included In The Autumn Deal (This Was Not Clear From The Confirmation Email) But Did Not Receive A Reply
column28: Cannot Remember - First Floor  Far Corner Of The Main House
column39: We Learnt The Next Day That We Had Dined On The Chef's Night Off. The Waiter Was Really Sweet But To Call Him Professional Would Be To Overstate Things
column59: We Will Be Back This Autumn As We Come Each Year To Shoot Nearby

column28: Nonington Was A Little Cold  The Radiator Does Not Work Well As The Hot Water Pipe Going Into The Radiator Is Incorrectly Connected To The Top Of The Radiator Instead Of The Bottom; As Hot Water Rises The Hot Water Just Forms A Small Layer On The Top Of The Radiator Instead Of Filling It.

column20: Friendly And Efficient Welcome. Upgrade To Suite Was Very Much Appreciated  Room Was Beautiful. Bathroom A Little On The Small Side. Restaurant Meal And Service Was Excellent. I Did Find That The Restaurant Was A Little Too Quiet. Open Fires Made The Experience Very Relaxing.
column39: Restaurant Was A Little Too Quiet.
column54: The Gentleman Who Looked After Us In The Bar And Advised On The Whisky And Gin Was Very Friendly And Knowledgeable.

column20: Very Welcoming In All Respects  Particularly Enjoyed Relaxing In Such An Historical And Interesting Place.
column28: Very Peaceful And Comfortable.
column54: Thought The Manager Mr. Murray Very Courteous And He Took The Time To Have An Interesting Converstion About The Manor And His Life In South Africa.

column20: In My Top 5 Hotel Stays Ever... !
column54: Jacob - Outstanding!
column58: Perfect
column59: Hope To Be Back With The Family

column20: Excellent. Courteous Service  Excellent Food And Lovely Room.
column28: The Shower In The Bathroom Was A Trickle. Not A Major Issue And Did Nothing To Detract From What Was An Excellent Stay But A Decent Shower Would Be Lovely.

column20: We Really Enjoyed Staying At What We Described As "The Tower Room"..Adjacent To The Main Building. It Was "Bijou"But Perfect For Us. Mr And Mrs Murray Senior Always Seemed To Be Around..Both During The Evening And Again The Following Morning..Which Gave Things The Air Of A Private Houseparty..Unusual But Fun! We Thought That The Menu For Our Evening Meal Was Very Interesting And The Food Was Excellent. It Was A Lovely Short Winter Break.
column24: Everything Was Fine.
column54: Mr And Mrs Murray Were Delightful. All Staff Members Were Friendly And Couteous

column20: Warm And Welcoming  Extremely Comfortable
column24: Put Sign At Junction Of Main Road And First Turning To Left(Travelling From The East) To Read: Lewtrenchard Manor Hotel Take Next Left Hand Turning. My Gps And That Of Several Of My Chums Took Me Via The Back Door Route Which Caused Some Angst On A Dark And Rainy Night.
column28: Nice To Experience A Fully Workable Shower. Lighting Too Was Exceptionally Good
column39: I Did Not Enjoy The Food  Far Too Fussy And Hard To Establish From The Since I Have Used Your Name In Vain Thought That You May Wish To See The Below Sent To All Members Who Joined In 2013.   Your    Rupert     From: Rupert Lendrum  Sent: 17 December 2013 16:15 Subject: To New Members 2013   Dear 2013 ‘Joiner’    The Board Are Absolutely Delighted That You Joined Buck's In 2013 And They Hope That You Are Enjoying Your Membership.   I Am Sure That There Are Still A Few Questions About Membership That Perhaps Remain Unanswered  Or Indeed Any Other Question That You May Wish To Pose. I Am Always Very Keen To Help In Making Your Club The Place That You Like To Come To But I Can Only Do That By Listening (And Watching) And Absorbing Suggestions And Feedback. Please Do Not Ever Hesitate To Contact Me About Any Aspect Of The Club And Being A Member Of The Club That You Think Needs Addressing. By Email Is Completely Fine Or My Direct Line Is 020 7292 2905.   One Of The Questions That I Am Often Asked Is The Procedure For New Candidates. Please Absolutely Do Not Be Hesitant In Proposing Candidates; There Is No Imposed Time Limit Before Which You Can Propose A Candidate. You Would Be Amazed That Some Clubs Impose A Time Limit Of Between 2-5 Years Before A New Member Can Propose A Candidate. Not At Buck's! It Is Not Simply A Question Of Wanting More Members (Always Welcome) But What I Expect May Be Important To You Is To Have The Ability To Propose Your Friends. After All A Club Full Of Friends Is Much More Fun! Please Also Remember That There Is No Joining Or Entrance Fee Nor Is There (Yet) A Waiting List.   As Of 1 January The Number Of Members Will Be About 610 Which Is Really Fantastic And I Expect That At The End Of 2014 The Total Will Be In The Region Of 650  Probably More If The Upwards Trend Continues.   Anyway  I Really Do Hope That  Whenever You Joined This Year  Not Only Have You Been Able To Take Advantage Of The Club And Perhaps Some Of The External Activities But Also That Above All You Are Happy To Be A Member And Are Enjoying It!   From All The Staff  And From Me In Particular  We Wish You A Fantastically Enjoyable Christmas And A Superlative 2014. We Look Forward To Seeing You Here Very Soon (And Some Of You Tomorrow!)   Yours    Rupert     P.S. Some Of You Will Read About From Me Or Hear Of A Member Called Jolyon Fitzgibbon. He Is Entirely Fictitious! For More Information Please Visit Http://Www.Symanteccloud.Com ____ I Did Not Enjoy The Food Which I Found Much Too Fussy. The Presentation Was So Artistic It Was Hard To Establish Just What Was On The Fork.Also The Chef Uses Far Too Much Salt.And Why Must Meat Be So Rare.My Preference Is Always For Good Plain English Cooking With A French Twist.Even The Connaught Grill Is Reverting To To This After Several Years Of Nouveau- Diners Usually Express Joy But After One Experience So Often Did Not Come Back. In Making These Comments It Is Fair To Say That The Other Members Of The Buck's Club Shoot Were Delighted With The Food!  ______________________________________________________________________
column58: Food!
column59: Will Be Back

column20: A Very Personal Service. Nothing Is Too Much Trouble For The Staff To Do For Guests And Their Dogs.
column24: We Were Given A Very Warm Welcome And Offered Help On Our Arrival
column28: If I Was Forced To Make A Negative Comment I Would Say The Shower Was A Little Weak But We Had A Great Time And Look Forward To Visiting Again
column39: We Had A Fantatic Dining Experience. Definately Dine There On Our Next Stay
column54: Actually All The Staff And The Owners Made Us Feel Welcome. A Place You Imediately Relax In And Feel At Home.
column58: No
column59: The Times Article Was Accurate. We Are Very Pleased We Stayed And Dined At Lewtrenchard.

column20: Wonderful Experience  Great Hospitality. Quality And Style Throughout The Hotel Is Superb. We Opted For A Tasting Menu Which Was Well Served  Well Presented And Most Importantly Very Tasty! We Would Give This Hotel Our Top Recommendation On All Fronts.
column24: We Were Greeted By Reception Staff Who Insisted On Carrying Our Luggage To Our Bedroom  Which Was Very Nice. All Serving Staff Were Very Professional But Also Friendly  A Very Good Balance.
column28: St Gertrude Suite.....A Must!!
column39: As Previous Comments
column54: As Previous Commnets
column58: Two Nights For The Price Of One?

column20: Apart From The Commercial Aspect - Discretely Handled By Your Staff - It Was Very Similar To Staying At A Friend's Excellently Run Country House.   We Shall Be Back Before The End Of The Month.
column28: We Were In Nonington.  It Would Be Nice To Have Tea And Coffee Making Facilities In The Room.
column39: Your Chef Has A Real Flair With Fish
column54: No. The Standard Of All The Staff Was Very High.
column58: As I Said Earlier  Tea And Coffee Making Facilities In The Room Would Be Very Welcome.

column20: A Relaxing Stay With Good Food And Friendly Service
Beautiful Place  Lovely Staff  Very Relaxing. Left With A Happy Wife Many Thanks
column28: Melton. Beautiful Room With 4 Poster Bed  Would Have Liked Coffee And Kettle In The Room Only A Minor Thing And Didn't Cause Any Problem For Us
column54: Sorry Didn't Get The Name Of The Tall Young Man In A Suit With Dark Hair .He Made Every Effort For Us And Nothing Was To Much Trouble It Was A Pleasure To Be Served By Him.

column20: We Were Made To Feel Very Welcome And As If Nothing Would Be Too Much Trouble. The Atmosphere Was Relaxing And All The Staff Were Polite And Friendly. Our Room Was Very Comfortable And Quiet. The Food Was Excellent.
column28: Very Comfortable Bed And The Room Wasn't Too Hot As Is Often The Case In Hotels.
column39: The Food Was Wonderful. All Courses Were Beautifully Presented And Everything Was Well Cooked. There Was A Good  Choice Of Dishes And Menu Changes Each Day.

column20: It Was Very Relaxed  A Perfect Way To Celebrate And Catch Up With Family In An Unhurried Fashion!!  I Couldn't Have Wished For Anything More - It Was Wonderful And We All Want To Come Back!!  Thank You So Much.
column24: No - It Was Excellent Prior To Arrival And On Arrival And Sorting Out The Various Rooms And Meeting The Needs Of The Occupants I.E. My Father Who Was Meant To Be In The Four Poster But Wouldn't Have Managed Its Height - But My Daughter Loved It!!!
column28: I Suppose  The Only Down Side Was The Shower!  In The Evening Before Dinner There Was No Pressure In Our Room And In Henrietta's Room  Resulting In Her Having To Wash Her Hair Under The Tap.  In The Morning It Was Fine.
column39: It Was Absolutely Wonderful.  None Of Us Could Fault It.  The Flavours Were Superb - The Additional Courses Were Great And The Marshmallow Is Still Being Mentioned!!!    You Couldn't Have Served A Nicer Meal For Us.  Also  I Would Like To Thank You For The Happy Birthday Chocolates Which Were Very Much Appreciated.
column54: Everybody Was Very Friendly - Even The Lady Cleaning Who Very Kindly Offered To Get A Key For Our Room When I Had Thought Marcus Was In There And Wasn't!!
column58: No - It Was Perfect!!!
column59: I Wish We Had Found You Sooner.

column20: We Were Made Most Welcome And Enjoyed Our Beautiful Room - Warrington. The Food Was Excellent. A Beautiful Hotel And Conveniently Close To Home!
column24: No - Really Pleasant Friendly Attention.
column28: Warrington. I Think Some Sort Of Refreshment Facilities In The Room Would Be Perfect. We Stay Regularly At Bath Priory  Gidleigh Park  Hotel Endsleigh And Our Local Favorite Is At Coombe House Hotel. I Think Tea/Coffee And Homemade Biscuits In A Jar Would Be A Nice Touch.
column59: We Will Certainly Be Back  We Really Enjoyed Our Stay. Excellent Food  Very Comfortable Room.

column20: Peaceful  Friendly Relaxing With Good Food And Service

The Atmosphere Is Relaxed But Staff Attentive And Friendly. The Room Was Very Comfortable And Clean. I Like The Attitude To Guest Dogs As Sometimes Places That Say They Accept Dogs Put Quite A Lot Of Constraints On Where They Can And Can`T Go And I Have Felt Both Times We Have Visited The Dogs Are As Welcome As Us. Food Was Lovely Again And I Know We Will Visit Again. Thank You
column24: No Level Of Contact Was Suffcient

column20: Yet Another Lovely Stay .Room Nice And Warm On Arrival .

column1: We Had No Heating Or Hot Water After Supper Or In The Morning Due To Boiler Disaster .
Staff Found Us A Room Inside The Main Hotel Where We Could Use A Bathroom And Warmed The Room For Us With A Heater.
Champagne On Check Out Was A Kind And Thoughtful Touch.

column20: Always A Good Standard .Dining Rooms Charming Staff Very Good
column35: Felt Very Sorry For The Lady Who Had To Check Everyone Out And Explain About Boiler .She Was Very Professional
column40: Thank You All For Another Great Stay .Love The Big Roaring Fires

column20: Welcoming And Relaxing Just A Shame It Was So Short
column28: The Room Was A Little Cold. I Didn't Say Anything As I Don't Mind But On Reflection You Should Know For Future Guests.

column20: A Delightful Time.
column24: Genuine And Warm
column28: Shower A Bit Slow And Floor Freezing But For The Location Not A Problem.
column39: Perfect
column54: All
column58: Nothing More
column59: Just Thanks

column20: Comfortable  Relaxed  With Extremely Helpful Staff And Good Food
column24: Jo On Reception Was Very Accomodating And Helpful Regarding Our Stay
column54: Jo  For Managing Our Booking When We Had To Change The Dates Of Our Stay Due To My Daughter's Illness

column15: Other: Friends Of Janie And James In Dartmouth
column20: Travelling With Our Bichon We Were Treated Beautifully - Loved The Whole Experience And Especially The Food
Interesting Welcoming And Relaxed. A Comfortable Spot
column28: Liked The Separate Sitting Room

column20: Always A Pleasure To Come And Stay  Service Is Friendly And Efficient Without Being Imposing.

column1: In Places  Decor Is Looking A Bit Tired Now And Could Do With A Little Attention  However This Does Not Detract From The Overall Experience.
column5: Being Recognised On Arrival And Comments Like "Nice To See You Again" Make You Feel That You Are Very Welcome.

column1: But Seeing As You Asked  And As Previously Stated  The Decor To Do With A Little Attention  And The Lower Hinge On The Main Door Needs The Screws Tightening.
column24: Strongly Agree
column28: Neither Agree Nor Disagree

column20: One Of The Best Experiences Ever. The Whole Stay Was An Absolute Delight.
column24: We Couldn't  Initially Get The Front Door Open  But The Receptionist Was Only Moments Arriving To Let Us In  Having Seen Us Approaching.
column28: We Stayed In The St. Gertrude Suite.

column1: The Shower In The Bathroom Didn't Seem To Work  Could Well Have Been Us Doing   Or Not Doing  Something Very Simple.
column12: It Was A Very Good Meal With All The Courses Explained To Us As They Were Served.
column24: Strongly Agree
column27: No One Member In Particular: All Were Polite And Helpful When Needed.
column28: Agree
column31: We Would Perhaps Have Liked To Have Seen  On The Portraits  A Note As To Who They Were. A Very  Very Minor Thing I Know.
column32: The Overnight Stay  In Celebration Of My Husband's Birthday  Was A Delight. We Were Looked After Very Well And Look Forward To Returning For At Least An Afternoon Tea At Some Point.
column39: Events

column20: Good Overall. Staff Very Pleasant  Service Good. Food Wise Our Expectations Were A Bit More Than Was Delivered.
column39: It Was Fine But We Would Have Liked To Have Been Blown Away By The Food.
column58: Put 'Wow-Factor' In The Food!

column20: Lovely Stay  Staff Very Friendly And Helpful.
column28: Would Like Tea And Coffee Making Facility In Room  Although Complimentary Available In Morning Which Was Great. Thanks!
column39: Would Prefer More Choice For Bar Menu  But Food We Had Was Very Nice. We Don't Tend To Eat Large Meals With Several Courses.
column54: Not Sure Of Name  But Lady Who Showed Us To Our Room On Arrival. Very Nice  Polite And Friendly Throughout Stay.

column20: It Was Perfect  From The Welcome We Received Through To The Peace And Tranquility It Was The Perfect Escape. No Mobile Signal Was A Definite Perk!
column24: I Would Book Directly In Future  The Staff Were All So Hospitable And Helpful. It Really Was A Great Get Away And We Will Definitely Be Returning!
column54: The Lady Working On Reception When We Arrived  I Didn't Catch Her Name  But She Was Really Welcoming  Friendly And Made Us Feel At Home.

column20: Our Stay Was Enjoyable  The Staff Were Very Nice .I Felt That The Dining Room Was A Little On The Cold Side.Our Room Was Very Nice .The Little Touches Such As Flowers And Champagne Were Very Well Received.

column35: The Gentleman Who Took My Booking On The Telephone And Was On Reception When We Checked Out Was Most Helpful.
column39: I Don't Think So.
column40: We Would Like To Look Forward To A Future Visit.

column20: At The Top End Of "Good"  Not Far Short Of "Excellent".
column28: We Were In St Gertrude.  Overall We Liked The Room A Lot.  When We Arrived After A Damp Journey  The Room Was Full Of Sunshine And Felt Particularly Welcoming.  A Couple Things To Think About  However:

column1: (I) Some Sign Of Wear And Tear In The Bathroom (Eg Tiles Under Basin And On Floor).
(Ii) The Windows Do Not Shut Tightly  And In High Winds (Which Happened While We Were Staying) The Draft Appreciable.
column12: We Stayed Three Nights  Dining Twice Off The Table D'hote Menu  And Once With The Tasting Menu.  While The Food Was Very Good On All Three Occasions  The Extent Of Duplication Between The Table D'hote Menu And The Tasting Menu  And The Fact That The Table D'hote Menu Did Not Change Meant That By The Third Night We Found That Options That Avoided Repetition Were Limited.
column24: Agree
column28: Neither Agree Nor Disagree
column31: It Is A Shame That The Open Fires Have To Be Hidden Behind The Large Metal Guards.  Perhaps This Could Be Overcome If The Fires Were A Bit Bigger.  On Our First Evening The Bar Felt Cold  Which Seemed Almost To Be Exacerbated By The Small Size Of The Fire In The Large Fireplace.  Make Them Big!  Let Them Roar!
column32: I Woke On Our Last Morning Feeling Unwell.  Please Be Assured That I Put This Down To A Gastric Bug  Not Food Poisoning!  I Was Disappointed Not To Be Able To Have My Final Full Lewtrenchard Breakfast.

column20: The Room Was Excellent And The Staff Were Very Pleasant And Efficient. The Room We Ate In On Our Arrival Was Rather Sterile And Lacked Any Atmosphere. We Were Surprised That Having Been Informed On The Phone And By E Mail That Jeans Were Not Acceptable Wear For Dining That There Were People In The Dining Room Wearing Jeans.
column39: As Before  The Large Room Was Devoid Of Any Atmosphere And Not Really Condusive To A Valentines Dinner
